data.name: errCap_devError
data.value: Device error

data.name: errCap_dihError
data.value: DirectInput error

data.name: errCap_effError
data.value: Effect error

data.name: errCap_impossible
data.value: "Impossible" error

data.name: errCap_invalData
data.value: Invalid data

data.name: errCap_noEffect
data.value: No effect

data.name: errMsg_dihCantAcquire
data.value: Cannot acquire device.

data.name: errMsg_dihGetDevStat
data.value: Cannot get status of the device.

data.name: tip_conditionDeadband
data.value: Area around the offset at which the effect's force will be zero. Range: 0 - 10000 Range of deadband: Offset-Deadband - Offset+Deadband

data.name: tip_conditionNegCoeff
data.value: Coefficient constant on the negative side of the effect. Range: -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_conditionNegSat
data.value: Maximum force on the negative side of the effect. Range: -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_conditionOffset
data.value: Device's position relative to its center at which the effect's force will be zero. Range -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_conditionPosCoeff
data.value: Coefficient constant on the positive side of the effect. Range: -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_conditionPosSat
data.value: Maximum force on the positive side of the effect. Range: -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_constantMagnitude
data.value: Strength of the constant force. Negative values create an inverse force. Range: -10000 - 10000

data.name: tip_directions
data.value: Direction of the effect expressed in cartesian coordinates (where applicable).

data.name: tip_envelope
data.value:
Envelope is a set of conditions that adjust effect's magnitude at the beginning and the end of playback.
When an envelope is applied, effect's magnitude changes gradually from a start value to target value when the playback starts and then fades to a final level at the end of the playback.

data.name: tip_envelopeAttackLevel
data.value: Magnitude at the beggining of playback. Range: 0 - 10000

data.name: tip_envelopeAttackTime
data.value: How long should the magnitude be changing to the target one (in microseconds).

data.name: tip_envelopeFadeLevel
data.value: Magnitude at the end of the playback. Range: 0 - 10000

data.name: tip_envelopeFadeTime
data.value: How long should the magnitude be fading to the final one (in microseconds).

data.name: tip_generalDelay
data.value: Delay before the effect starts playing (in microseconds). 0 = Start immediately

data.name: tip_generalDuration
data.value: How long the effect should play (in microseconds). -1 = Infinite

data.name: tip_generalGain
data.value: Overall strength of the effect. Range: 0 - 10000

data.name: tip_generalTrig
data.value: Start playback when a button is pressed. Number corresponds to the button number reported by the device. -1 = No trigger

data.name: tip_generalTrigRep
data.value: Delay between the end of one playback and start of another one (in microseconds). Applicable only if the effect is triggered by button. 0 = No delay

data.name: tip_periodicMagnitude
data.value: Maximum strength of the effect. Range: 0 - 10000

data.name: tip_periodicOffset
data.value: Ranges of forces generated by the effect. Generated ranges: Offset-Magnitude - Offset+Magnitude

data.name: tip_periodicPeriod
data.value: How long will one cycle of the effect last (in microseconds).

data.name: tip_periodicPhase
data.value: Position in the cycle at which the playback will start. Range: 0 - 35999
